column4: I'm wanting to install Windows next to my Debian install, will I be able to use the Ubuntu 9.10 live cd to restore grub 2 (as per https://help.ubuntu.com/community/Grub2#Reinstalling GRUB 2), I'd assume it doesn't matter whether I'd use Debians or Ubuntu's 'update-grub' and 'grub-install'?
is devian using grub2 or grub1 ? thats a big differance
I'm on Debian's testing, which uses grub2
so, mh, did you mean that if it's using grub2 it will probably be allright?
should be. but im not sure how different grub2 is on the various disrtos.  Theres a lot of work on grub2 going on. so  there may be version differances.
would there be any way to sortof do a 'dry' test?
(before I go ahead and install windows and blow up my MBR)
Try it and see I guess..  It pays to learn how to use grub and repair it. :)
with most 'repair' operations you could boot a live cd and chroot into the installed system. that way its using the proper grub files for that disrto

ah, mhh,  "https://help.ubuntu.com/community/Grub2#Reinstalling GRUB 2" recommends to use the Ubuntu binaries, it'd make sense to not honour that step and instead make sure to use the binaries from my Deiban install
yep. Unless of course you are testing out some new features of grub2
the ubuntu grub2 dosent support LUA for example. or some other 'in progress' features.
nope, nothing in particular
the only reason I'm using grub2 is because aptitude told me it had a fancy new shineh package ready for me :P
im not sure if debian uses a similer config files for its grub2 either. Ubuntu has /etc/default/grub and /etc/grub.d     No idea what debian uses
grub2 has some really really really neat features. I got a flash drive with grub2 setup to boot my ubuntu.iso file :)
*nod*, it shouldn't matter if using my install's grub binaries though, no?
i then did changes to my ubuntu's grub2 configs where i can also boot an iso file from the hard drive as a 'recovery'  option
i wouldent think so
yeah, I'm glad to see linux is moving forward with the whole grub thing
neat
progress... gotta love it.. gotta hate it...
hehe, I don't mind it much, the progress that is, I'm hoping things will get more intuitive
looks like it works, at least the "grub-install --recheck /dev/sda" part worked fine!
